definition: a resting stage of a plant (such as the lily, onion, hyacinth, or tulip) that is usually formed underground and consists of a short stem base bearing one or more buds enclosed in overlapping membranous or fleshy leaves
a fleshy structure (such as a tuber or corm) resembling a bulb in appearance
a plant having or developing from a bulb
a bulb-shaped part
a rounded or swollen anatomical structure
a camera setting that indicates that the shutter can be opened by pressing on the release and closed by ending the pressure
a rounded part of some plants that is under the ground and that grows into a new plant during the growing season
a part that has a rounded shape
light bulb
a dormant stage of a plant that is formed underground and consists of a very short stem with one or more flower buds surrounded by special thick leaves
a plant structure (as a tuber) that is somewhat like a bulb

a rounded object or part

a rounded dilation or expansion of something cylindrical
